chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chao Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
NO contact with anyone under 18 years or under unless as approved by PO. 

NO contact with victim or her immediate family.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 

Sex offender registry for lifetime registration.  

Restitution all uninsured counseling and treatment that victim requires if based upon health professional that it is reasonable and necessary because of crime, up to an amount of $10,000.00 

25% of prisonaccount must be used for all court fees/restitution/costs. 

Electronic monitoring/any other programming as deemed appropriate by PO.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:14am
State appears by ADA R. Uttke; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Glenn White.

PSI has been received and reviewed by all parties; Parties do not have changes.
COURT notes receipt of letters from friends, family, supporters, as well as victim impact statements of victim and victim's mother.

Argument by State on sentencing argument.
Argument by Atty White on sentencing argument.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT makes findings.
COURT ORDERS:
Cts 1 and 2>> 10 Years TOTAL: 7 years incarceration and 3 years ES, on each count, concurrent, w/credit for 86 days of time already served on each count.

CONDITIONS: No contact with anyone under 18 years or under unless as approved by PO; No contact with victim or her immediate family; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Sex Offender Registry for Lifetime registration; CC; Restitution all uninsured counseling and treatment that victim requires if based upon health professional that it is reasonable and necesary because of crime, up to an amount of $10,000; 25% of prison account must be used for all court fees/restitution/costs;  Electronic monitoring/any other programming as deemed appropriate by PO.

>>Defendant IS NOT eligible for CIP or SAP 
>>Defendant is remanded to MCSD for transport to WI State Prison System.

Case called: 8:50am
Clerk Cheree
Bailiffs John and Jane Reid
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Rich White.
JURY TRIAL - DAY 2

COURT notes JI conference yesterday and the verdicts - Both counsel agree that instructions and verdicts are acceptable.
COURT addresses transcript exhibit - argument by both parties regarding that exhibit being allowed during deliberation; COURT takes matter under advisement at this time.
8:58am - JURY Reconvenes.
COURT notes that State has rested and defense may now present testimony/evidence.
C.V. sworn and testifies.
9:22am - Defense rests; COURT reads jury instructions to jury.
9:36am - Closing argument by State; 9:57am - Closing argument by Attorney White.
10:19am - Rebuttal closing by State
10:28am - Final closing instructions by COURT; Alternate juror chosen, thanked and excused (Juror seated #21 K.A.B.)
10:33am -- Bailiffs sworn and JURY retires to deliberate.
10:34am - COURT recesses
11:38am - COURT Reconvenes - Jury has submitted question re: being given exhibits 3 and 4 in jury room; Neither counsel object - COURT gives exhibits 3 and 4 to bailiff to deliver to jury; OTR: 11:40am
12:05pm - COURT reconvenes (defendant not present) - Jury has submitted question re: being given exhibit 5; Argument by both counsel; COURT composes response and bailiffs give to jury; Bailiff returns with note from jury to request to watch portion of exhibit 5; Additional arguments on playing portion of exhibit 5 - COURT makes rulings; 12:55pm - JURY reconvenes and COURT states portion of exhibit 5 will now be played for them; COURT plays video and jury retires for further deliberation.
1:08pm - JURY/COURT reconvenes - jury has reached verdict; COURT reads verdicts and polls each juror - each juror agrees with verdicts read.
Ct. 1 - GUILTY
Ct. 2 - GUILTY
COURT thanks and excuses jurors - JURY recesses
STate moves for entry of verdicts - defense does not object; COURT grants and enters verdicts of guilty on both counts as found by jury
State moves for revocation of bond - Argument by defense; COURT revokes bond at this time and orders PSI; Counsel to set PSI sentencing date at this time.

Clerk Cheree
Bailiffs John and Jane Reid
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Rich White.
JURY TRIAL - DAY 1

9:10am -Bailiff opens court - COURT reads case information; JURY panel sworn; Attorneys and witnesses identified.
9:16am - Voir dire by COURT; Juror seated #11 M.L.P. excused for cause by COURT and replaced with Juror seated #24 J.D.G.; Juror seated #14 D.R. W. excused for cause by COURT and replaced with Juror seated #25 G.E.S.
9:22am - Voir dire by Atty Uttke; Juror seat # 22 M.V.P. excused for cause by COURT and replaced with Juror seated #26 I.M.P.
9:55am - Voir dire by Attorney 
10:07am - COURT ORDERS counsel to strike jury list.
10:16am - Clerk reads list of jurors chosen to hear case; Thanks and excuses remaining jurors.
10:18am - JURY sworn and COURT reads preliminary instructions to JURY.
10:23am - JURY recesses.
COURT questions parties regarding final offer - State files final offer w/court and Atty White notes receipt and defendant has chosen not to accept.
COURT addresses MIL from State - both parties state agreement.
Atty White requests copy of transcript with revisions from witness forensic intereviewer - argument by State; COURT makes rulings.
COURT also questions counsel re: jury instructions from State - Defense to give any objections or any additions to COURT as soon as possible.
COURT recesses 10:30am- Reconvenes 10:50am - COURT questions parties re: transcript issue
10:54am - JURY reconvenes; Opening statement by State.
11:02am - Opening statement by Atty White.
11:16am - Testimony begins.
Jacqueline Gremler (forensic interviewer) sworn and testifies.
11:24am - JURY recesses; Parties record sidebar
11:25am - COURT recesses - reconvenes12:31pm 
12:33pm - JURY reconvenes; Witness reminded she remains under oath; Testimony of Ms. Gremler continues.
12:37pm - Video of interview played for jury.
Testimony of Ms. Gremler continues.
2:25pm - JURY/COURT recesses; 2:46pm - JURY/COURT reconvene.
Witness reminded she remains under oath and testimony of Ms. Gremler continues.
Jury recesses/reconvenes for arguments on witness -3:01pm-3:09pm; Testmony of Ms. Gremler continues.
3:15pm - M.T. sworn and testifies - identifies defendant.
3:28pm - M.C. sworn and testifies - identifies defendant.
Prosecution rests subject to rebuttal. 
COURT admonishes jury not to discuss/research case or use social media.
3:47pm - JURY recesses for evening.
Atty White states defendant will be testifying as witness; COURT questions defendant regarding decision to testify.
COURT Recesses at 3:57pm - counsel to obtain their copies of JI/verdicts before leaving courthouse tonight.
TO BE ERASED - ENTERED IN ERROR
